channel.title: Missing libtcmalloc library in the latest release of the game
channel.description:
It appears that the libtcmalloc library is missing from either not compiling with it before release or because it's missing from the bin directory. When I try to run the command [tt]./bms_linux[/tt] in the terminal I just get the message
[code] /home/pingu/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Black Mesa/bms_linux: error while loading shared libraries: libtcmalloc_minimal.so.4: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory [/code] I think a quick patch with libtcmalloc may be needed soon.

item.title: Missing libtcmalloc library in the latest release of the game
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Pingu
item.description:
I’ll go ahead and test that out real quick. I’ll edit this reply when I get back to it.

So yeah, it did run in the public beta branch. I need to try out multiplayer but so far so good.

Read full topic

item.title: Missing libtcmalloc library in the latest release of the game
item.dc:creator: djcj
item.description:
I think the beta branch already has it. I wish they would do at least a minor update on the main branch for Linux.
